depolarization.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : depolarization.c                                                *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Takes the semiaxis lengths of an ellipsoid in array axis, and calculates    *
00009 * the depolarization factors numerically using a high quality Gauss-Legendre  *
00010 * quadrature, returning them in array Ld.                                     *
00011 ******************************************************************************/
00012 
00013 /******************************************************************************
00014 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *

00017 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *

00019 * This file is part of depSolver.                                             *

00025 *                                                                             *
00026 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00027 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *

00029 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00030 *                                                                             *
00031 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00032 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00033 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00034 ******************************************************************************/
00035 
00036 #include "depolarization.h"
00037 
00038 int depolarization(double *axis, double *Ld)
00039 {
00040     unsigned int  i;
00041     double  A, a2, b2, c2, J, L, R, W, x;
00042     double  N[2], XL[2];
00043     double  X[2][2];
00044 
00045     /* Initialize */
00046     Ld[0] = Ld[1] = Ld[2] = 0.0;
00047     X[0][0] = X[0][1] = X[1][1] = 0.0;
00048     A = 0.5*axis[0]*axis[1]*axis[2];
00049     a2 = axis[0]*axis[0];
00050     b2 = axis[1]*axis[1];
00051     c2 = axis[2]*axis[2];
00052 
00053     /* Integrate for Lx using Gaussian quadrature */
00054     X[1][0] = 100*a2;
00055     for(i = 0; i < 64; i ++){
00056         L = GaussH[i][0];
00057         W = GaussH[i][1];
00058     
00059         shape_line2(L,N);
00060         J = X2L_line2(X,XL,N);
00061         x = XL[0];
00062         R = J*W/sqrt((x+a2)*(x+b2)*(x+c2));
00063     
00064         Ld[0] += R/(x+a2);
00065     }
00066 
00067     /* Integrate for Ly using Gaussian quadrature */
00068     X[1][0] = 100*b2;
00069     for(i = 0; i < 64; i ++){
00070         L = GaussH[i][0];
00071         W = GaussH[i][1];
00072     
00073         shape_line2(L,N);
00074         J = X2L_line2(X,XL,N);
00075         x = XL[0];
00076         R = J*W/sqrt((x+a2)*(x+b2)*(x+c2));
00077     
00078         Ld[1] += R/(x+b2);
00079     }
00080 
00081     /* Integrate for Lz using Gaussian quadrature */
00082     X[1][0] = 100*c2;
00083     for(i = 0; i < 64; i ++){
00084         L = GaussH[i][0];
00085         W = GaussH[i][1];
00086     
00087         shape_line2(L,N);
00088         J = X2L_line2(X,XL,N);
00089         x = XL[0];
00090         R = J*W/sqrt((x+a2)*(x+b2)*(x+c2));
00091     
00092         Ld[2] += R/(x+c2);
00093     }
00094 
00095 
00096     Ld[0] = A*Ld[0];
00097     Ld[1] = A*Ld[1];
00098     Ld[2] = A*Ld[2];
00099 
00100     /* Safety checks */
00101     for(i = 0; i < 3; i++){
00102         if(Ld[i] < 0.0) errorHandler("Error: depolarization() - factors must be positive!");
00103     }
00104     if(fabs(1.0 - Ld[0] - Ld[1] - Ld[2]) > 0.05)
00105         printf("Warning: depolarization() - error is larger than 0.05");
00106 
00107     return 0;
00108 }
